mods.abstract: This file consists of:A summary of a letter from Sir James Outram to the Governor General of India (2 May 1857), regarding regiments being sent to India, and Outram’s intention to remove all the troops from Mohamra [Mohammerah, now Khorramshahr] and to place at Karrah and Bushire [Bushehr] all the troops not sent to India, and correspondence with the Persian Commander regarding the cessation of hostilities between Persia [Iran] and Great Britain.Summaries of Letters to Lord Clarendon (George William Frederick Villiers, British Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs), reporting the view of the Persian Commander that no formal armistice was necessary following the ratification of the Peace Treaty, and Outram’s announcement to the Persian Commander of his intention to remove the troops from Mohamra.
